subject: Re: [junit] Sun doesn't use JUnit. Why?
msgSnippet: Aside from neither of these existing when they originally set up the build and test processes, ant is less suited than make to managing a large, complex
messageBody:
Aside from neither of these existing when they originally set up the
build and test processes, ant is less suited than make to managing a
large, complex project that consists of a wide range dependencies and
tasks. Can you imaging trying to use ant to build a VM?

On Saturday, April 26, 2003, at 04:46 AM, javainsel wrote:

> Today I downloaded "Java(TM) 2 SDK, Standard Edition (SCSL) 1.4.1"
> from Sun: http://wwws.sun.com/software/java2/download.html
>
> It includes the sources, tests and makefiles which are not included
> in the Java SDK 1.4.1.
>
> When I unpacked the archive which I've downloaded, I discovered that
> Sun doesn't use JUnit. They have custom test classes which are not
> automated like JUnit tests.
>
> Besides this they don't use Ant. They have some kind of makefiles
> instead.
>
